inn1.comm: good length ball just outside off, with a little bit of movement away. The batsman is not interested
back of a length, targeted at the batsman as Mahela gets on top of the bounce and defends with soft hands
fullish ball on and around off stump, Mahela is tentative in defense as he gets an inside edge onto pad
pushed down the ground to mid-on off a full length ball on middle
oh, he goes for a cut. It wasn't quite short enough for that, but it definitely had room. Comes up with just air though
maiden to start with. You could have bet on that as he finishes off with a good length ball on the off stump corridor. Mahela tightens up and lets it through
that was inviting and Dilshan just could not help himself. Threw the bat at that as he went for a thunderous cover drive but cannot connect.
that goes right over off stump! Very brave from Dilshan as he lets that go to the keeper as this one pitched outside and ducked inward at the stumps.
on a length on middle and Dilshan steps forward to block
slammed down the ground as SL and Dilshan get off the mark. It was quite full and Dilshan presented a very strong straight bat
goes short and that was pulled straight at the square leg umpire, who manages to step out of the way as it goes down to long leg
on the pads again and he stays in his crease and picks it off behind square on the leg side
maintains a good line and length outside off and Dilshan refrains from playing at it
gets just that tad bit closer to off stump and Dilshan wanted to drill this through the off side, but he was a little too early into his drive and only manages an inside edge to mid-on
back of a length on off stump as Dilshan gets back behind it and blocks
excellent line from Mills. Keeps to a fifth stump line and this one was just short of a length and Dilshan is happy to let that through to the keeper
a bit fuller, but still on that off stump corridor, with a little seam away. Dilshan watchfully leaves it alone again

too full this time and Dilshan gets this one right off the middle of the bat through cover. Mills provides a rare half-volley and the batsman tucks into that one. He was just looking to pierce the gap and Dilshan's power does the rest
good bowling there. Hint of inward movement restricts Mahela to defend that good length ball down the pitch
attempts the short ball again and he just uses the pace available to send it packing to the fine leg boundary. He should be looking to bowl a lot fuller than that
sticks to back of a length again, but this time his direction is better. It was on off stump and gets a little more bounce than Mahela thought. Shaves the bat and gets struck on the thigh

oh, Anton Devicich, that was not needed. Unnecessary throw to the keeper, but it was far too wide of him and they sneak a single. It was a very good shortish ball again as Mahela's pick-up shot was of no use as he gets struck on the body and the ball runs off to point
loads of carry there. Dilshan banks on it as he lets the back of a length ball on middle and off through to the keeper by swaying away
gets forward to meet the good length ball on middle with a stoic, straight bat
charges him but hasn't time it. Thick outside edge goes uppishly past point and down to third man
wanted to play at that, but in the end pulls his bat away from the back of a length ball on that curiously tempting off stump corridor
oh, sprays the full length down leg and the umpire reprimands him. Was looking for that magic away-swinger I think
oh, exquisite. He seems to have shoveled the full length ball swinging away from him through the covers for another powerful four

back to back boundaries and this one is on the opposite side of the ground. Mills over-pitches again with the slower off-cutter and the batsman spots it and flicks it away effortlessly through midwicket
magnificent. Thuds into the pitch and leaps over the infield on the off side and scurries off to the cover boundary. Brilliant drive from Dilshan
a little extra bounce defeats another flashing drive from Dilshan. This was held back in length a little bit, but he was enticed by the room on it
on a length on middle and leg as Mahela gets back behind it and defends
oh, extra bounce again and Mahela's tentative defense is beaten as the ball goes past the outside edge
too short and Ronchi does well to leap high and collect the ball well over his head.
this time he loses his line down the leg side. Mahela was looking for a tickle to collect another boundary but isn't successful
this time he gets bat to it but goes straight to short fine leg. On a length on the pads again but Jimmy Neesham saves a bit of the blushes for the bowler as that flick was well timed
quick single and easily done in the end. Came forward to the length ball on off stump and dropped it in front of cover. Grant Elliott is not quick enough
oh he gets him with a little tangle there as the quick, shortish ball pushes him back and evades the little flick shot he tries and hits him on the stomach

was that glove?! Yes it was. Would be too cruel to call it a drop as Ronchi jumps as high as he can and the ball ricochets off the top of his glove and to the fine leg fence. Good short ball from McClenaghan, hurried into Dilshan as he wanted to hook
just a little bit of extra bounce again but Mahela negotiates it well, playing it off with soft hands into the leg side and run through for the single

risky single and had that been a direct hit, Mahela would have been gone! He wasn't even in the frame as Dilshan whips it away to the short leg fielder and looks for the single. Mahela responds, but that could have been curtains
on a length on middle stump as he keeps it out with soft hands again. Is there anyone better at manouvreing the ball as good as this guy?
and as if to prove my earlier comment, he goes down on one knee and sweeps it fine of the man at short fine. This one was well outside off stump
good length ball outside off and he stays back to steer it down to third man and collect a single
full length ball outside off stump invites Dilshan into the drive again. He's not been shy with that shot but this time the fielder at cover misfields to give away a single
beats him for pace and bounce. There was appreciable inward movement after pitching as well as Dilshan was cramped for room and the ball runs down to slip off his thigh
short ball again, rising toward his chest as Dilshan stays in line of it and blocks, pulling the bottom hand off the bat
fuller this time, but his search for inward movement keeps him on the pads of the batsman. Dilshan flicks this away square of short fine leg and collects two
digs it into the middle of the pitch again, but this one doesn't rise as high and isn't quick enough either as Dilshan sways away from the line effortlessly
the angle helps his short-pitched bowling as he draws the batsman into a pull shot that isn't fully under Dilshan's control. But the square leg area is vacant and the single is taken
gets a little bit extra off the pitch as this one goes right off the shoulder of Mahela's bat. He did well, removing his top hand on impact and tucked it towards fine leg

that's in the air and evades the midwicket fielder by a couple of yards. Grant Elliott was the man chasing after that miscue as Mahela stepped across to the off side and looking to play the pick up shot over midwicket. Instead he got a leading edge
much better as he meets the good length ball on off stump with a solid forward defensive

what a shot! That was what he wanted to do two balls ago and he holds his pose. Length ball with just enough room outside off for him to hoick it over cow corner. It was a slog, but he looked so very good
ducks into the batsman off a length as Mahela moves to the leg side and steers it away to point
full and on the pads as Mahela plays it below his eyes and whips it away to short miwicket. It as timed too sweetly for the fielder to stop comepletely

false shot from Dilshan and that could have been his end had Ellis been a little taller. It was a slower ball and he was drawn into an uppish drive. The leading edge squirts to the left of the bowler and he dives full length, parallel to the ground, but cannot reach
offers up a little room and he places the cut shot just wide of the man at point to pick up a single
pushed through on off stump and Dilshan gets forward to keep it out
short and wide again, but there is a cover point in place to bolster the part-time left-armer. Dilshan's cut shot goes straight to him
another cut, this one didn't have too much room, but Mahela's footwork made that shot possible as he makes room by going back behind leg stump and drilling it to point
again makes some room outside leg and punches the short of a length ball on off stump through the covers
full length ball on off stump as Dilshan pushes to mid-off off the front foot
on a length on middle and leg and he turns it away to midwicket
looks to play the same shot, but this one had a little more inward movement and Mahela can't connect.
comes forward to the line of the full-length ball outside off stump and works it away to the man at midwicket
slides down the pads again and Mahela waits for it to come to him and nudges it away to deep fine leg
off cutter, bowled full just outside off as he drives to mid-off off the front foot
This time he beats midwicket as the full length ball on off stump is whipped to the man in the deep

brilliant. He spotted that ball tossed up and was immediately down on one knee. Though the ball was outside off stump, his sweep shot connected perfectly, so much so it went for a one-bounce four down to fine leg
pushed through on middle and leg as he blocks to mid-on
and when he tosses it up again, Mahela pulls out the sweep. Action replay of that last boundary with short fine leg still up in the circle
steers it to point off the front foot as he holds this one back
terrible ball, the spinner drags it down the middle of the pitch and it is just too easy for Mahela as he cuts it fine of the point fielder.
delivers a full toss now. Mahela's completely rattled the part-timer here. Easy put away through straight of midwicket after he went forward to meet it before it pitched
punched off the back foot to long-on as this is angled into the batsman from outside off stump
tucked away off his hips as he waits for the slower ball, pitched a little short of a lenght, to come to him
he's concentrating on bringing the ball into the batsman, and this one is on a fuller length, causing the batsman to come forward and defend
oh, he's missed that. It was full and on the pads. Looked to be an easy flick through midwicket and he just played all around that

oh, and he makes up for it immediately. Deft little touch past the wicketkeeper to signal another boundary. This was coming into him as well but the length - short - helped him ease into a lovely little late cut
on a length on off stump and he punches it into the covers to end the over.
tossed up, a little too much as this is a full toss. Mahela wanted to beat short-fine leg but the fielder moved to his right to save the boundary
this time he cannot stop it. It is a sweep shot again, Mahela's been exceptional with that shot today as he plays that all along the ground to the left of short fine leg
nudged to short fine leg again off a flighted ball on leg stump
tossed up on middle and it is worked away to deep square leg
oh, that was close! Gets a little extra bounce and Dilshan who was looking to late cut that gets a thick bottom edge and it was dangerously close to the off stump before going towards point
tossed up outside off and it is pushed to cover. Drinks are on the field
whipped away to deep midwicket off the back foot as the length ball is delivered from around the wicket

oh, what have you done, Mahela?! He's fallen on his own sword as he goes for a paddle sweep. The ball was not full enough and it was outside off stump as well. He should have pulled out of the stroke, but went through with it, and the ball runs off his face straight up in the air and Ronchi picks up the simplest of catches
tossed up on off stump and he comes forward to defend solidly

oh my God, N Mac how do you keep doing this?! It was a good length ball on off stump. Sanga misread it and went for the pull, missed completely, almost comically as the ball stayed a little low and went under his bat. Just shaves the off stump and the bails are disturbed. The umpires are in discussion though. They want to make sure it wasn't the keeper's gloves that disturbed the bail. To me it looks like Sanga has to walk back and it is confirmed by the third umpire.
pushed through on leg stump as he comes forward and keeps it out
flights it this time on middle and leg as the batsma gets a good stride forward and blocks
worked away to the right of midwicket as he starts off with a length ball on middle and leg
excellently flighted just outside off and Thirimanne gets nicely forward and drives it to long-off
oh another deliciously soft dab to go off to the boundary, this time to fine leg. He played it with the turn and the ball was already on leg stump. Dilshan showing his versatility here
tossed up outside off stump and he gets forward to defend
held it back as he keeps it outside off stump and he goes back to punch it through to deep cover
nicely flighted on leg stump and as Dilshan looks to sweep and misses, the umpire calls wide
nudged straight of the man at midwicket and he rushes through for a couple. Fifty for Dilshan
gives it some air, all the spinners are happy to do that with Mahela's exit, as he comes forward and blocks
pushed off to mid-off as this one is full and outside off as well

uses the flight of the bowler as he charges down the pitch. He had almost overrun the ball but managed to give himself enough room to use a full swing of the bat and slam it straight over the bowler's head
worked away square on the leg side as he collects a single. Intelligent batting
pushed through on off stump. Very little spin on offer here as the ball goes on with the arm. Dilshan stays back just to check if it would turn and when it didn't, nudged it away to cover
tossed up outside off and he drives to extra cover
drills it past the man at point as he bowls a yorker outside off stump.
well bowled and well played. There was a hint of in dip from this full length ball on middle and he presented a good straight bat to counter it
oh, a little loos there but he survives. It was a good length ball angled across the right-hander. Excellent change-up from McClenaghan, which drew Dilshan into an on-the-up drive

but this time he's nicked it! It was much fuller, so the drive was on, but McCleaghan got it to move just the right amount and just late enough to beat the middle of the bat and catch the edge. The bowler and keeper erupt

another one, same ball, same shot. Sri Lanka are faltering here. Excellent outswinger from McClenaghan again as Mathews goes for a loose waft outside his off stump. He should be a lot more tighter so early in the innings. The edge is taken and Ronchi takes a good low catch as the umpire relents to the appeal
solidly defended. It was on a length, using the angle across the right-hander, who gets behind the line of it to keep it out
nicely flighted again as he gets forward and prods down to mid-on
pushed through on middle and leg as he goes back and whips it away to midwicket
nudged to midwicket off a length ball on the pads
tossed up on middle and leg and it is carefully worked away to midwicket again
gets down the track and having not reached the pitch, he blocks
forays past the batting crease again and blocks to end the over

loud appeal for leg before but that was too high. McClenaghan is asking loads of questions as he finds consistent movement off the pitch. The left-hander had stepped forward and was struck above the knee-roll though as the ball darted into him
gets back behind that length ball and defends safely off the back foot
square drive, opens the face of the bat on impact and gets the ball past point. And it has enough timing to beat deep third man as well. That should release some of the pressure for Sri Lanka
holds a steady length and line, but this was just a little too far outside off to interest the batsman
on a good length but he is still affording a little too much room outside off to draw the batsman into a shot
bowls this one from wide of the crease for variation, but he doesn't get the result he wanted as the ball was far too wide outside off

well played. second boundary off the over and certainly the best of the two. It was full and coming in at him, but Thirimanne stayed balanced at the crease and punched the ball down the ground. Mid-on dives but cannot stop it
tossed up on middle as he comes confidently forward to defend
turns that into a full toss and drives fluently down the ground. Mid-off does well to save it
keeps it flighted outside off as he steps towards the ball and tucks it away through midwicket
horrible ball as he races down the track and meets it at just below the high high full toss and slams it over wide long-on for a four
worked away through midwicket and he runs well to come back for the second

excellent use of the feet again and though he didn't quite seem to have reached the pitch of that ball, Chandimal goes through with the shot, always looked to hit it straight and lofted it over mid-on
this time he takes it away from the left-hander, who was drawn into a a defensive prod. McClenaghan continues getting some late movement
this one is too short and so it goes on a straight line outside off stump. Thirimanne lets it go
slower ball this time from Mitch as Thirimanne gets forward and defends
on a fullish length outside off stump, but after that poke, Thirimanne refuses to be tempted
full length on middle and off and he gets forward to block
yorker length ball on leg and he clips it off to fine leg quite comfortably
steered to point as it was shortish with just a little room outside off
this time he runs it off the face of the bat to third man as the bowler goes a lot closer to off stump with his back of the length ball
on middle and off and he gets forward to block quite solidly

oh, that could have been close despite Chandimal's dive. The fielder at mid-off was a little slow and had that been a direct hit that would have been out. It was a good ball, which might perhaps have risen a little higher, as the ball went up in the air off the splice of the bat
excellent strike. It was full and he exploits the room available on it as he leans forward and drives through extra cover
solidly back behind that full length ball on off stump as he blocks
back of a length as Chandimal gets up on his toes to dab it away to point
short ball again, dare I say he's one of those heavy ball bowlers? This one thuds into Chandimal as he chops it to cover point
thick outside edge carries the full-length ball just outside off down to third man
easily flicked off the hips to deep fine leg as Neesham strays in line with this shortish ball
bouncer, but the direction was all wrong. There was appreciable height on it, maybe a little too much.
looked to whip that back of a length ball through midwicket and though he did make contact and his wrists were working in overdrive, he can't get it away
this one is much fuller and on the pads as well making this an easy put away. Chandimal clips it strongly to deep square leg
short of a length ball angled into the body of the batsman is picked off his hips behind square on the leg side

lobbed it to mid-off. It was a slower ball from Mills and Thirimanne was into his shot early. He's been driving quite well this innings, and maybe this was a little bit of over-confidence because that ball wasn't half-volley length. It hits him high on the bat and Tom Latham completes a relatively simple catch
starts off with a bouncer rising up around head-high as he gets back behind it and blocks
he tries, but the extra bounce beats him. It was a little too close to cut as well as Mills keeps it just outside off stump with the shortish ball
length ball homing in on off stump is nudged to mid-on off the crease
another slower ball to end the over, but Perera has seen this and dabs it just to the right of point who dives but cannot save the single
back of a length on middle and leg and Perera blocks it down the pitch
this time his line is a little too straight and he clips it down to fine leg off the back foot

the umpire waited a long time to give that one. Chandimal has a little word with the umpire as he walks off. Neesham was very earnest in his appeal having angled this one on a fuller length - something he's been sparse with in this short spell - and makes the batsman play all around it. Impact was just below knee-roll on the front pad, no bat involved. Could just have clipped leg stump
shortish ball outside off stump as he dabs it away to point off the back foot
short of a length outside off stump as he lets it go to the keeper

dropped That was hit back fiercely by Kula. Neesham went at it gingerly and the ball ricocheted off towards extra cover. But wait, Neesham is running off the field. He seems to have hurt his little finger while going for that
pushed through on off stump as he comes forward gingerly to push into the covers
tossed up on middle and off as he steps forward and drives through the covers
shortish ball with a little room outside off stump as Perera cuts it behind square on the off side
tossed up on middle and leg as he plods forward with a straight bat
get to this on the full and times the straight drive quite well, but a long-off is in
opens the face on impact as he drives this full length ball out to cover point
keeps it right up there on the block hole as he digs it out to mid-off
length ball on off stump, but because of the angle, he works it away to fine leg off the back foot
room afforded outside off as he persists with a shortish length and Perera flays it through extra cover
oh, well bowled. That got a little extra bounce and with a straight seam, it gets a little movement away as well. Kula wanted to play at that and misses
goes full and straight as Kula moves to the off side and goes for a wild slog with his weight on the back foot. Doesn't connect with bat, but sneaks an extra
drilled to cover as he continues pushing a few full-length deliveries with his staple length which seems to be just shortish
poor start, very poor start as he offers up a half-volley which Kula duly deposits over extra cover with a full flow of his bat

very well bowled. It was the slow yorker, brave choice that for the free-hit ball. Kula was setting himself up to slog it over the leg side but very few people could have got under that and it squirts off to fine leg off the pad
employs the wide yorker to keep Perera quiet as he gets his bat down in time to push the ball wide of mid-off
slower ball bouncer which is left alone, but the keeper fumbles as the ball bounces just before him and they sneak a bye

slower ball dupes him. No feet there from Perera as Latham gets under it at point and the batsman has to go. Or does he? umpires are checking for the no ball. There was enough room for Perera's flay over the off side, but the lack of pace did him in as he gets a top edge. Third umpire confirms it's out after a smidge of his boot landed behind the line
steady diet of slower balls here from Ellis, but this off cutter grips a little too much on the pitch and goes down the leg side
shortish ball on middle and off is whipped away through vacant midwicket but there is a man in the deep
on a length as he opens the face of the bat to dab it to point, who is right on the 30-yard circle and Kula pulls him through for the single
length ball pitched way outside off and moved further away. Take it over umpire
steered to point who swoops in quickly to prevent the single as he bowls a length ball on off stump
pulled away towards square leg as the shortish ball darts in at him. The lack of timing helps them get a couple with the man stationed in the deep
excellent bowling again as he gets this to straight off a length. The batsman poked at it feebly to no avail
length ball just outside off and he lofts it over cover and the ball lands safely. Good running from Sri Lanka as they take a couple
another beauty as he pegs the batsman on the glove while he was charging down the track. Senanayake was ducking for cover and the ball lobs over the keeper. Excellent bowling this from Neesh
short ball to finish up and this time the batsman ducks underneath
on a length just outside off stump as he gets back behind it and defends
change of pace again as he moves to the leg side and slams it over point's head. The ball was dribbling away to the boundary but Anton Devcich chases it down with the help of two of his comrades
slower short ball from Mills but this time the batsman had seen it and pulled it away in the gap wide of mid-on who escorts it to the boundary
oh, french cut and Ronchi does well to save it from going for runs. It was shortish just a little outside off and the cut shot gets a thick inside edge
on a length as he uses the room outside off stump to dab it to point
drives the slower ball pitched up to the batsman outside off  down the ground to retain strike

that goes straight up in the air and the first ball of the batting powerplay fetches a wicket. He kept it full and on middle and leg, Kula moves outside leg to slam this down the ground but he can't get enough bat on it as Mills runs around from mid-off to pick up the catch
yorker speared in on leg stump and Senanayake makes some room himself and drills it to Elliott at cover
fiery short ball that goes right over leg stump. The batsman left it looking for a wide, but he has to contend with some disappointment
but he doesn't let that get to him as he cuts crisply through point. There wasn't much room on offer, but he made his own and timed it perfectly
back of a length as he angles it at Herath's body. he goes for a wild hoick and misses as Neesham gets a little more bounce than he expected
oh my God, he just flicked that over cover's head. It was full on off stump and he shoveled it over the in field and collects another much needed four
follows the batsman as he makes room outside leg with a short ball, but the batsman is good enough to pull it to deep square leg
that sailed over Herath's head. The ploy was good as he invested in a quick, short ball but he extracted a little too much bounce
flat batted down the ground. The bat face had turned on impact as he met this slower ball with an agricultural slog with his front foot out of the line of his bat swing.

he's pierced the gap between the two points! This is excellent hitting from Herath! He was making room for himself again and the bowler tried to fox him by bowling a full yorker outside off. It ended up a full toss and he reached out and met the ball at just the right time to get it over the two men
full length ball well outside off stump and he drags it away to long-on with another flat-batted slog
that's outta here! Length ball from Ellis and Senanayake gets under it and imbues enough power to sent it sailing over the wide long-on bounday. 17 off this over alreadly
full length ball on middle but he drills it right into the stumps. The deflection takes it towards midwicket and the batsmen sneak a single as 18 come off that over

inn2.comm: flighted on middle stump and as he goes forward to defend the ball takes the inside edge and runs away to deep square leg
tossed up on middle and leg again as he comes forward and pushes to mid-on
this time it's a little too wide outside leg and he sweeps it to short fine leg
turn! its the offspinner pitches just before his bat and takes the outside edges as it runs away toward point
holds this one back as Devcich punches to cover
more turn! This time he waited on the back foot, but it was so sharp that it turns across the outside edge of his bat and goes into the keeper's gloves
away swinger to start off with, but he's usually a bit more fuller as the batsman stays on his back foot and dabs it to point
goes for another cut shot and he was right in doing so because there was enough room for it, but this one swings away a little to beat the bat
taps it off to point as he covers the swing a little by moving onto his back foot and towards the line of the ball
inswinger, it was always on the cards. He was caught on his crease and his flick shot was a little late as well as the ball hits him on above his pad. Hence Kula's appeal is turned down
that one is too far down the leg side and even Kula's away swinger can't get it back in line of the stumps
full and straight but this has some late swing as the batsman's defensive shot manifests in an outside edge
short ball and he pounces on it. No swing that time as he stays balanced and punches it strongly through the off side infield
full length ball on off stump as he stays in his crease and pushes it down to mid-off
gets under that and pulls out the slog sweep. It was the off spinner so he was playing against the turn but got enough bat on it and the area was vacant as well
pushed thorugh on middle and leg as he goes back and whips it thorough midwicket
just a little outside off stump and he pushes into the covers off the back foot
play and miss. It pitched on off and straightened a little bit as the batsman was looking ot punch into the off side, but misses
this time he manages to send the length delivery into the covers
leading edge as he squares the batsman up. Latham was looking to tuck it away thorugh midwicket but is beaten by the turn as the ball goes along the ground to the bowler
that goes right over leg stump as the batsman moves right across to flick it to fine leg. The bounce saved Devcich there as Kula bowls back of a length
back of a length on leg stump again and he gets back behind it to defend

he wanted to clear the infield, but mid-on foils his plans. Herath gets into play again. It was a length ball and he was going for a flat-bat pull over the top. I think it hit him right on the bottom of the bat than he would have wanted hurting his timing
beaten first ball. Inviting length just outside off stump. He came forward and looked to block, but the seam away defeats him
back of a length on off stump and he goes back and across to defend
keeps it on a length outside off again and this time Nicol ensures his bat is well away from the line of that
chopped away to the point boundary. It was on a length, but his footwork made that shot possible. Went right back and just looked to place the ball wide of point and he succeeds
cut shot again and this time he plays it so late but this time it goes straight to backward point
chips down the track and blocks with bat and pad close together
plenty of bounce on offer to Senanayake as he tosses this up just outside off. Latham is not interested in playing
pushed thorugh on off stump as he gets forward a little gingerly and blocks
turns across the outside edge as he went back to defend the length ball
back of a length coming in on off stump as Nicol stays back and works it away to midwicket
too wide down the leg side and it was the inswinger too. Nicol went for the flick, but misses

oh, that was another indipper and Nicol just managed to get his bat in front of his pad as he shuffled across to the off side to nudge it to square leg. There was a bit of bounce to save him had he missed it though
charges Kula again and this time he gets an inside edge, a thick one that runs away to short fine leg
finishes with another one darting back into the batsman as he pushes towards the midwicket region
on a length outside off stump as he comes nicely forward with a punch into extra cover
back of a length, starting outside off. The batsman moves towards the line and adjusts for the inward movement and pushes it back to the bowler.
length ball just outside off and it is punched into the covers

that one came on with the arm and Latham is struck on the front pad as he came forward to defend. The impact was below the knee-roll and despite the stride forward that full length ball would have crashed into middle. He did look a lot more comfortable off the back foot and Senanayake might just have seen that
and he is beaten by the doosra! Pitched on off and went further away and Elliott was always playing for the turn
gets gingerly forward and pushes back to the bowler
another doosra and this one gets the leading edge. it was in the air, but far too wide of the bowler as it went away towards mid-off
appeal for leg before as he pushes this on middle. Elliott comes forward to jam his bat down on the ball. I think it was bat first
starts well with a good length ball just outside off. He gets forward to block and plays it soft enough to push towards mid-on and get off the mark
keeps it outside off stump on a good length and he lets it go
extra bounce beats the batsman comfortably. He was poking at the back of a length ball rather tamely and Angelo thought he had his man
this time he steers the length ball outside off to third man to open his account with a couple
dabs the length ball coming in at off stump just behind point, where Mahela does well
more appreciable bounce nullifies that leg before appeal. And he got some bat in as he stepped forward to defend a big inswinger pitching on a length outside off
spears it on off stump as the batsman comes forward to defend. Gets a thick inside edge onto his pads
holds this one back a little as he goes forward and blocks gingerly
he strikes! wanted to cut the flatter ball just outside off stump but there just wasn't enough room on it. And that fact is proved when he inside edges the ball onto his stumps
gets forward to the full length ball and nudges to midwicket
another loud appeal for leg before, but that was turning too much. Another batsman who doesn't look too confident on his front foot.
stays back to the full length ball and looks even worse as he just manages to get his bat down in time. Nervy start for Munro

strikes first ball back! It went on with the arm again and this was much quicker than his previous balls. Munro had no clue about that as he went back possibly just to defend, but as the ball came at him he tried to adjust, but wasn't good enough as the leg stump is knocked back
greets him with another one that goes straight on with the arm as he waits for it and steers to point
another one that goes across the batsman as he stays back and blocks
this time it is the off spinner and he stays back and defends solidly

oh, well played. That didn't turn either and Ronchi, having already shown inclination to stay on his back foot, rides the bounce and guides it with an open face behind point and it has enough on it to go to the boundary
beaten again, and there is more evidence of bounce. Ronchi comes forward to defend and the ball doesn't turn into him a he expects

oh, is that another wicket? Herath dupes Nicol in flight as he draws him out of his crease and Sanga does the rest. Third umpire confirms and Herath has two wickets in two overs. A miserable stay for Nicol comes to an end as he strays from the safety of his crease to meet the tossed up ball outside off and it turns away from him as well.
pushed thorugh outside leg and that is an easy escape for the batsman who tucks it away to fine leg
considering the situation, that was well played. It was shortish and he went back, opened up his stance and cut it well to cover point
more uncertainty when the ball is pitched up as Neesham steps half-forward and works the ball to short fine leg
arm ball from Herath and Ronchi just manages to get his bat down in line of the ball after thinking it was going to turn away from him
there was a fielder in the deep, but Ronchi hits the slog sweep well enough to clear him as Herath pushes another length ball thorugh. Strong shot, much needed shot
flatter, fuller ball on middle and leg, defended down the pitch
little more flight on offer and he steps forward and drives to mid-on
shortish ball, gets a little bit of extra bounce to evade a straight forward cut shot
fires it in on middle and Neesham whips it to midwicket
pushed through on middle and leg as he goes across to his off stump and works it away toward square leg
drops it short as the ball goes on with the arm. Should have been pulled away, but he doesn't connect
tossed up on off stump and he was looking to work it away through midwicket, but gets a leading edge through to point
chips down the track and slams it over the infield to the man in the deep and Thisara sends in a rocket through to keep it to one
driven back to the bowler who gets a hand to it and the ball ricochets onto the stumps, but Neesham was safe and they take a single
dabbed away to point off the back foot and with a straight face of the bat
flatter ball with a little room is cut to point
tossed up on leg and he gets forward and plays with his bat coming in front of the pad. They go for the single but it would have been tight had midwicket hit the stumps direct
considerably more slower and tossed up as Neesham picks it away off his pads to short fine leg
length ball with a little room outside off and he chops it off to deep point
pushed thorugh on middle stump as he goes back and punches back to the bowler
similar ball, but Ronchi manages to punch it wide of the bowler
waits for it and opens the face of the bat on impact to guide the length ball to point
tossed up on off stump as he comes forward to defend
whipped away to deep square leg as Herath bowls a flatter, quicker length ball on the pads
goes fuller this time but the batsman still goes back and gets an inside edge
chips down the track and meets the ball on the full as he drives down to long-on
length ball which keeps a little low that time as Ronchi goes for the cut, even though there wasn't enough room with the bowler darting the balls into the stumps. Gets an inside edge
length ball with no flight, punched down the ground to long-on
full length ball met off the back foot with a defensive bat
makes some room outside leg as he goes right back in his crease and drives the ball to long-off
tossed up on middle stump as he comes forward and for a change looks comfortable with his defensive stroke
he's on the front foot again and this time he is able to use the angle from around the wicket to work it away to deep midwicket
back foot punch to the length ball on off stump takes it to long-off
slower and tossed up as Neesham flicks it to deep midwicket
on a length but this one was outside leg stump as he sweeps the ball behind square leg to pick up a single
slower, length ball on middle and it turns across the batsman who stays back and blocks
more turn for Herath as Ronchi has to adjust to the ball and dab it to point
in the air towards midwicket, but it bounces just short of him. That was dangerous as Herath is bowling a lot slower now
goes back to punch the length ball to long-on
tossed up on leg stump as he gets forward and works it away to deep midwicket

excellent ball to finish. The batsman was in two minds as this one was angled in at him. He was wondering where it would turn I think, but it doesn't, coming on with the arm and he manages to keep it out
fifty for NZ as this one is pushed through on leg stump and he comes forward and drives down to long-on
tossed up outside leg and he gets forward to defend, but only manages an inside edge onto his pads
a little width outside off stump and he uses it to open the face of the bat and guide it away to point
on of a length just outside off stump and he goes back to block
on a length darted through and is whipped away through square to return the strike to Neesh
turn for Dilshan this time as Neesham reaches out to the shortish ball outside off and dabs it to point
right in the block hole as he homes in on middle stump. Ronchi drills it to cover
goes back and gets to his full height as he punches the ball down the ground

the outfield is still quick enough despite all the rain and that little punch from Neesh, as he went back to the length ball to exploit the little room on offer through the covers. First four in seven overs
tossed up on middle and leg as Neesh gets forward and drives down to long-on

lofts it over the bowler's head as he gets under the full length ball. It wasn't looking to go for a boundary, but the spin on the ball takes it to the right of Thirimanne who was running around from long-off

he;s gone now! and Jonty takes the catch. Let me clarify, Senanayake at point, whose nickname is Jonty, swoops in on the ball and dives fully forward to collect a great catch as Ronchi looked to guide the ball square off the stumps. And mercifully for my fingers, It is drinks
whips it away quite wristily to long-on as he bowls a full length ball on off stump. Very sub-continental shot that
tossed up on leg stump and he comes forward and hits it to the right of midwicket to get off the mark
chips down the track and lifts the ball over midwicket as he gets a thickish inside edge
another foray down the track as he dabs the ball to the left of midwicket who runs around and dives to stop the single. Excellent work from Chandimal
lofted to deep midwicket and that was quite close to Thisara, bouncing just in front of him as he ran to his left in his quest to get underneath it
length ball turning into him as N Mac works it away to square leg
starts off with a shortish ball with enough room to be slapped off the front foot to deep cover
bouncer first up and it was excellently directed as well, coming in at his shoulder. He swivels on his back foot to hook the ball down to long leg
slower ball and the batsman cannot get all of it as he goes back to slog and it lobs over the top of the bowler and dribbles away to long-on
its the slower, fuller ball this time and Neesham gets confidently forward and drives it quite well through the covers, right of the man in the in-field
short ball, this time on the off side. I dont know what he was doing there, maybe trying to ride the bounce to third man but ends up splicing it down the pitch
the famed Malinga yorker, but Neesh gets his bat down just in time and works it away to deep midwicket
cut away between third man and point inside the circle to ease a little bit of the pressure, NZ need a lot more of them. he waited nicely for that one
cut again, this time to cover point as Dilshan drops a second ball short and wide outside off
came down the track, but Dilshan holds this one back and the batsman had to adjust as he checks his shot into a defensive prod to midwicket
slammed away over cow corner! Length ball on middle and leg and he just dismisses it away from his presence with a belligerent slog sweep
driven down the ground as he gets on his front foot to negotiate the full length ball on off
full-lenght ball, drags it from outside off down to long-on to retain strike
slower yorker, I think it was the off cutter and he turns it away to midwicket. Mathews at midwicket picks it up, takes aim and just misses the stumps. McCullum was gone for all money
bouncer, but the umpire deems it just a little too high. Neesh was looking to hook that away as well but it was just too high even for Sanga
yorker again, right on the base of middle stump as Neesham digs it out towards midwicket
slams it over extra cover as Malinga strays on the yorker, yes don't rub your eyes, you read that right as this time Malinga bowls a full toss and N Mac takes full advantage
slower bouncer and McCullum did well in the end because he was into the shot early, waited for the ball to get to him and pulled it away to deep square leg
slower ball on a length this time and he dupes Neesham who was looking for the big hit down the ground and instead gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
change of pace to finish again as he goes back and works it off his hips to deep square leg
slower length ball, off the back of the hand, on middle stump is pulled away square of the man at midwicket. Lots of power in that stroke
full toss on off stump is driven down the ground for a single
loud appeal from Sanga behind the stumps, but that full toss was definitely going down the leg side. No bat on it as Neesham looked to whack it away through square leg
right up there in the block hole but Neesham digs it out and has struck it well enough to evade the man at long-on. Impeccable ball-striking

take a couple off a bunt down the ground. Kula bowls a full toss this time and it is struck back down the pitch, the ump had to take evasive action and in all that some good running meant they steal an extra run
full toss, this time on leg stump is carted away to deep midwicket for a single

dropped and that takes the partnership to fifty as the short ball is whacked to deep square leg. It was going low to Kula out there and after having made his ground, he doesn't get he lets it slip through. Malinga is not impressed, but then immediately smiles
yorker, with a little away swing as the batsman made room outside leg and looked to hit it through extra but misses
up and over backward point, Excellent shot from N Mac with third man inside the circle. Short ball, slower as well and it is cut extremely well
hi-high full toss on middle stump and he picks it off to the right of midwicket and the outfield takes it away to the boundary. NZ getting a move on here
another full toss, at shin high this time and he clips it away to deep square leg. NZ are doing considerably better against the seamers
"push push" comes the call as Neesham whips the length ball on the pads behind square on the leg side and the take a couple
